node.title: This is what $1 million will get you in Hobart's hot property market
node.alt: An old timber house with peeling paint
node.description: This federation home in one of Hobart's premier streets may be "in need of repair" but that isn't deterring those keen to take on the challenge in Tasmania's hot property market.
node.content:
["While many inside and outside Hobart's property market are viewing with disbelief \"gobsmacking\" house prices, a new report is shedding light on another reason home ownership is out of reach for many in the island state.\u00a0", "The Core Logic report shows Tasmania has had the biggest gap between wage increases and house price growth in Australia in the past 20 years.", "A federation home in one of Hobart's premier streets is the latest example of just how hot the market is getting.", "It may be spruiked as being \"in need of repair\" but that isn't deterring those keen to take on the challenge in Tasmania's hot property market. \u00a0\u00a0", "The 1900's property in Stoke Street, New Town has attracted \"enormous\" interest since it went on the market for offers around $1.15 million this week.\u00a0", "", "
The house is tipped to go for more than the asking price in the current market.(Supplied: Peterswald)
", "Billed as \"ideal for those seeking a restoration project\" and a \"rare\u00a0blank canvas\" the property has already received multiple offers.", "Real estate agent John Morgan said mostly it was locals wanting to restore the home to its former glory.\u00a0", "\"I think local people are trying to snap up properties like this to keep the mainlanders out,\" Mr Morgan said.", "\"Given the interest shown I'd think we'd have a very strong result well in excess of the indicator but who knows in this market.\" \u00a0", "Mr Morgan said the house had been occupied until earlier this year.", "\"The previous owner loved it and lived in it but it needs some renovation to bring it up to the standard that most people want to enjoy these days,\" Mr Morgan said.\u00a0", "It's yet another example of Hobart's hot property market which is getting further out of reach for some.", "", "
The Stoke Street house in its heyday.\u00a0(Supplied: Peterswald)
", "
'FOMO' a factor
", "A Core Logic report released on Friday shows Tasmania's house prices have jumped by 300 per cent in 20 years.\u00a0", "Real estate agent Penny Flanagan has seen that in stark relief in the Hobart suburb of Mount Nelson.\u00a0", "Homes that sold for less than $200,000\u00a0in the year 2000 are now selling for up to $1.3 million.", "\"I put it down to FOMO \u2014\u00a0fear of missing out,\" she said.", "\"We have got a lack of stock at the moment and people are desperate to get in while the market is still half affordable.", "\"And people are worried about prices going even higher so they are offering ridiculous prices to secure the property.", "The\u00a0Core Logic report also shows Tasmania has had the biggest gap between wage increases and house price growth in Australia.", "", "
The\u00a0house is in a prime street in suburban New Town.\u00a0(Supplied: Peterswalds)
", "In the 20 years to September 2021, Tasmania's wage price index increased by 79.9 per cent.", "Nationally the wage rise was around 80 per cent, with home values up 193 per cent.", "Report author Eliza Owen said\u00a0the discrepancy in Tasmania was significant.", "\"It really does speak to the struggle that a lot of first home buyers would be experiencing at the moment in terms of trying to accumulate a deposit when income growth is relatively low compared to house price rises,\" Ms Owen said.\u00a0", "\"House prices are running away faster than people can catch up with their savings.", "\"If you own a home it's great, it means that your wealth is building really quickly and you're better off owning the asset rather than trying to grow your wages in a savings account.\" \u00a0", "Ms Flangan agrees it is getting tougher.", "\"We are still affordable for a lot of mainlanders but I feel so sorry for the first home buyers.\"", "", "
According\u00a0to the\u00a0agent,\u00a0\"the previous owner loved it \u2026\u00a0but it needs some renovation\".(Supplied:\u00a0Peterswald)
"]
